label: 鶴岡八幡宮
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
見出し読み: つるがおかはちまんぐう
説明文: Founded in 1061 by Minamoto Yoriyoshi as a branch of the Iwashimizu Hachiman Shrine, whose principal object of worship, the war god Hachiman, was the tutelary deity of the Minamoto clan. Originally located at Yuigahama, south of Kamakura, it was moved by Yoritomo in 1180 to its present site, in Yuki-no-shita, Kamakura, where it functioned as the protector of the shogunate. [源頼義、石清水八幡宮、由比ヶ浜、鎌倉、頼朝、雪の下]
